intro: Pecluma ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty pecluma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Pecluma ferruginea is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
